description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

allOf.description: Represents a request for a patient to employ a medical device. The device may be an implantable device, or an external assistive device, such as a walker.

bodySiteCodeableConcept.description: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the device should be used ( i.e. the target site).

bodySiteReference.description: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the device should be used ( i.e. the target site).

device.description: The details of the device  to be used.

encounter.description: An encounter that provides additional context in which this request is made.

identifier.description: Identifiers assigned to this order by the orderer or by the receiver.

indication.description: Reason or justification for the use of this device.

notes.description: Details about this request that were not represented at all or sufficiently in one of the attributes provided in a class. These may include for example a comment, an instruction, or a note associated with the statement.

prnReason.description: The proposed act must be performed if the indicated conditions occur, e.g.., shortness of breath, SpO2 less than x%.

orderedOn.description: The time when the request was made.

recordedOn.description: The time at which the request was made/recorded.

subject.description: The patient who will use the device.

timingTiming.description: The timing schedule for the use of the device The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013".

timingPeriod.description: The timing schedule for the use of the device The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013".

timingDateTime.description: The timing schedule for the use of the device The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013".

priority.description: Characterizes how quickly the  use of device must be initiated. Includes concepts such as stat, urgent, routine.
